title: Complete Search Space Exploration for SITG Inside Probability

author: Guillem Gasco, Technical University of Valencia (UPV)

segmentation: Hello NVM Glasgow and I'm I present this work done together with with Professors John and repented and Casa Miguel binary.
In this work we propose several modifications to the stochastic inversion transduction grammars parsing algorithm in order to achieve a full exploration of the search X space.
Stochastic inversion took showing grammar or ascites are kind of synchronous grammars used to parse two strings simultaneously.
Ascites and this means that in this production, the terminals must be inverted.
That means that in Spanish, Greek would trade La Casa Roja, whereas in English we would the Red House.
This is the parsing algorithm, its forests.
It's bottom up algorithm parsing algorithm an it was proposed in 1995 by the kibu.
And well, discuss a problem cause it can explore several valid parse tree according to the model we propose to relax this restriction and substituted for this by this one.
And we need also to change this order restriction in order to get to guarantee termination of the algorithm.

Using these modifications, we guarantee that the algorithm explore the whole search space and it has been proved in the paper while it maintains the same time complexity as the original algorithm and the experiments we show that for a high percentage of sentences, the original algorithm cannot find the parse tree with the highest probability, and we also show that for re estimation purposes, the.
Modified, the algorithm performs better than the original 1.
